word: AMONG THOSE VERY PROMINENT IN ELLEN WHITE'S CORRESPONDENCE CONCERNING THE AFRICA INTERESTS WAS A SOUTH AFRICAN FAMILY, THE WESSELS FAMILY, WHO HAD COME INTO THE POSSESSION OF CONSIDERABLE MEANS. PIETER WESSELS WAS ONE OF THE ORIGINAL TWO BELIEVERS WHO WROTE FOR HELP TO THE GENERAL CONFERENCE IN 1886, AND THIS ENTIRE FAMILY EVOKED THE DEEPEST INTEREST IN THE YEARS THAT FOLLOWED ON THE PART OF ELLEN WHITE WHO WAS CONCERNED WITH THEIR SPIRITUAL WELFARE, THEIR PERSONAL PROBLEMS, AND THE RIGHT USE OF THEIR MEANS FOR THE CAUSE.
